concept.name: Person demographics
concept.implamentationGuidance:
For the implementation of this Standard there are a number of 'Must Have' fields as well as the PDS Mandatory fields that are required as part of the NHS E&I Minimum dataset; e.g. gender and ethnicity.

This section contains the person’s demographic and contact details including key identifiers e.g. name, date of birth, NHS number, address etc.

• NHS number (or equivalent, e.g. CHI number in Scotland), is likely to be the primary identifier however existing national guidance should be followed, including how to handle patients without an NHS number, for example, overseas visitors.

The PDS (Personal Demographics Service) should be used as the source of this information. The mandatory information in this section is person’s name, date of birth. address. There can be multiple addresses associated with a person including temporary and correspondence addresses.
concept.description: The person's details and contact information.

concept.description: Details of the person's name

concept.name: Pronoun
concept.implamentationGuidance:
Focus groups held with users of the social prescribing service identified the need to capture a persons preferred pronoun (He/him, she/her, they/them) as an optional data item .  System suppliers therefore should look at being able to capture pronouns, however it is not a mandatory requirement currently. <br clear="none"/> 
                                 <br clear="none"/> For the avoidance of doubt, where possible, any fields that could be left blank should not be included in the outputs if there has not been any data entered into the field.
concept.description: The person's preferred pronoun e.g. she/he/they

concept.name: Gender
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This is not mandatory for providing care but is deemed as a 'Must have' to support other activities.

Section 22 of the Gender Reassignment Act 2004 makes it an offence to disclose the history of a transgender patient who has had formal gender reassignment under the Act, unless consent has been sought. The exemption of disclosure is for medical professionals involved in direct medical care, but not currently for administrative and non-medical staff. For the full Act, see https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2004/7/contents.

This risk can be mitigated by appropriate implementation; refer to the CIS clinical safety case report and hazard log. One option is to leave out the “Sex” field but the implications and potential risks of that will need to be considered. The alternative is to ensure the design, including its Information Governance model, reduces this risk to an acceptable level as described in the clinical safety case and hazard log. A further mitigation on implementation could be to record self-expressed gender in the administrative area of systems, and record sex at birth in a separate clinical area, that can only be accessed by medical staff.
concept.description: The person's stated gender.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Person stated gender code

concept.name: Person alias
concept.description: Other name(s) associated with the person.

concept.name: Ethnicity
concept.implamentationGuidance: This is not mandatory for providing care but is deemed as a 'Must have' to support other activities.  <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The ethnicity of the person as specified by the person.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Ethnic category

concept.name: Religion
concept.description: The religious affiliation as specified by the person.

concept.name: Sex
concept.implamentationGuidance:
The persons phenotypic sex. Determines how the person will be treated clinically The definitions used for sex and gender use the NHS data dictionary definitions to ensure interoperability with other systems. However, we recognise that the definitions used do not reflect today’s more inclusive society. We have provided feedback on this to NHS data dictionary team in NHS Digital who are actively addressing this area, and any updates to the NHS data dictionary will update our standards.

Sex and gender data items may cause accidental disclosure of gender reassignment without consent. This is because both fields are included in the demographic model. Having both may show a difference and therefore disclose gender reassignment without consent. It is unlawful to disclose, without consent, a person’s gender reassignment with or without a gender reassignment certificate recognise that the definitions used do not reflect today’s more inclusive society. We have provided feedback on this to NHS data dictionary team in NHS Digital who are actively addressing this area, and any updates to the NHS data dictionary will update our standards.
concept.description: The person’s phenotypic sex. Determines how the person will be treated clinically.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - person phenotypic sex

concept.implamentationGuidance:
This is not mandatory for providing care but is deemed as a 'Must have' to support other activities.  <br clear="none"/> 
                                 <br clear="none"/> Recording of a persons carer status can be via two Snomed CT Ref sets. A carer status (drop down list includes multiple options) or a code identifying the person as a carer can be used for simplicity in circumstances where fully coding would be impractical.  <br clear="none"/>

concept.name: Relevant contacts
concept.description:
Include the most important contacts including:

* Personal contacts e.g., next of kin, in case of emergency contact, lasting power of attorney, dependents, informal carers etc.

* Health/care professional contacts e.g., social worker, hospital clinician, care coordinator, key worker, Independent Mental Capacity Advocate (IMCA) etc.

Name, relationship, role (if formal role), contact details and availability, e.g. out of hours.
concept.valueSets: Details of relevant contacts, such as carers or family members, as recorded on the local system, or volunteered by the person. This will be a free text list of relevant contacts.

concept.name: Educational establishment
concept.description: If the person is a child, name and address of where the child attends, eg play group, nursery, school.
concept.valueSets: Free text or ODS code where available.

concept.name: GP practice
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This section contains details of the GP practice where the person is registered. This information would be sourced from PDS. This will include the GP practice identifier code.

In situations where a person is not registered with a GP practice, the GP practice identifier would contain the appropriate code to indicate this.

This section would also need to accommodate details for temporary GP where the patient is registered away from their usual place of residence

GP practice identifier’ does not need to be a displayed field. It is intended to be used to provide the GP practice details via lookup from national registers.

Many people will not offer a named GP. Only the ‘GP practice details’ section would need to be completed in these situations

A patient may be registered with more than one GP practice. Normally patients are registered with one practice, but may be treated as a temporary registration (e.g. whilst on holiday) by another practice. The registered GP practice can be obtained from the PDS.

Suppliers should enable more than one GP practice to be recorded to accommodate temporary registration. Communications will go to the GP surgery that the patient is permanently registered with. However, sometimes a GP who is serving a patient on a temporary basis may also need to access the transfer of care communication. In this instance, both GP practices should be recorded.

If a patient is not registered with a GP practice, then the GP practice record entry should appear with the text "No known GP practice".
concept.description: Details of the person's GP practice.

concept.name: GP practice record entry
concept.description: This is an GP practice record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items

concept.name: GP name
concept.description: The name of the person's GP. If the person is registered with a GP practice, their usual GP name will be something volunteered by the person or their representative.

concept.name: GP practice details
concept.description: Name and address of the person's registered GP Practice. Registered GP practice details are available from the Person Dempographics Service (PDS), or volunteered from the person or their representative. Include details of the practice name and address.

concept.name: GP practice identifier
concept.description: The identifier of the registered GP practice.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - General medical practice code (patient registration)

concept.name: GP opt out indicator
concept.description: Indication that the person has opted out of registering with a GP.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - 1092961000000104 |Does not wish to register with an NHS general practitioner (finding)| OR 1092941000000100 |Family using private general practitioner (finding)|

concept.name: About me
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This is a record of the things that a person feels it is important to communicate about their needs, strengths, values, concerns and preferences to others providing support and care, and is often captured  as part of a Shared Care Record.

This holds information that the person thinks it is important to share with professionals. This can be included with the referral if the link worker doesn 't have access to a shared care record where this would be available.  For more detailed implementation guidance please look at the following link https://theprsb.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/About-Me-Implementation-Guidance-v1.4.pdf
concept.description: About me

concept.name: What is most important to me
concept.description: A description of what is most important to you. <br clear="none"/>

concept.name: What is most important to me
concept.description:
A description of what is most important to you 
 Emergency Information : -  Include any essential information that any professional in health and social care should know about the you in any situation, including emergencies.
Other Information : - This could include : - Values, Spirituality/religion, Ethnicity, Culture, Pets, Goals and aspirations, Meaningful activities including leisure activities, visiting places, sport and exercise, listening to music, employment, education, volunteering

concept.name: People who are important to me
concept.description: Details of who is important to you and why.

concept.name: People who are important to me
concept.description:
Details of who is important to you and why. They could be family members, carers, friends, members of staff etc. Include how you want the people important to you to be engaged and involved in your care and support in both emergency and normal situations. Include how you stay connected to the people important to you. Who should not be contacted or
                            consulted about your care and support and why, if you wish to say

concept.name: How I communicate and how to communicate with me
concept.description: A description of how you communicate normally.

concept.name: How I communicate and how to communicate with me
concept.description:
A description of how you communicate normally including any communication aids you use, for example a hearing aid.

  • Include your preferred language of communication, if your first language is not English.
  • Include how you would communicate when you are in pain or distress.
  • Include how you communicate choices.
  • Include how you give feedback or raise a concern.
  • Include how you like to receive information

Describe how you would like others to engage and communicate with you, including how you would like to be addressed.

concept.name: My wellness
concept.description: A description covering what you are able to do, how you engage with others and how you feel on a typical day through to on a day when you are unwell or really unwell.

concept.name: My wellness
concept.description:
A description covering what you are able to do, how you engage with others and how you feel on a typical day through to on a day when you are unwell or really unwell

  • Include any causes that might result in you becoming unwell and strategies for avoiding or addressing the causes. For example, not drinking enough water could cause constipation.
  • Include any signs that indicate you might be becoming unwell.
  • On a bad day describe what is different about what you are able to do, how you engage with others and how you feel.
  • Include how your everyday life is affected by any medical conditions e.g. dementia and any symptoms e.g. itchiness, cough, pain and how you manage those conditions.
  • Include past health issues or experiences that need to be considered
  • Include your wellbeing and lifestyle goals and aspirations

concept.name: Please do and please don't
concept.description: A description of things you want someone supporting you to do (or not to do).

concept.name: Please do and please don't
concept.description:
A description of things you want someone supporting you to do (or not to do).
Things you want someone to  do  might include (for example): - Talk to me not to my carer, remind me to take my medication, encourage me to wash my hands regularly, explain to me what is happening and why, respond to my communication.
A description of things you  do not  want someone supporting you to do might include (for example): - Discussing or asking questions about certain topics, making assumptions about something, providing support when it is not wanted, talking to you in a certain way, undergoing a specific intervention or taking a medication the person does not want.

concept.name: How and when to support me
concept.description: A description of how and when you want someone caring for you to support you.

concept.name: How and when to support me
concept.description:
A description of how and when you want someone caring for you to support you.

  • This could include support needs in an emergency situation (for example taking blood)
  • This could include support you need to maintain important routines or to carry out particular activities, for example: - Personal care routines, Eating and drinking, Bedtime routines, Taking medications, Moving and transitioning
  • This could also include support needed with:- wearing glasses/hearing aids/false teeth etc, making informed choices or understanding dangers and risks, managing your emotions, moods and behaviours, memory or confusion.
  • Include how your support needs change in different environments. Include any triggers that might result in you needing further support and strategies for avoiding or addressing the triggers. Include how you want the support to be provided.

concept.name: Also worth knowing about me
concept.description: A description of what is also worth knowing about you for people caring or supporting you.

concept.name: Also worth knowing about me
concept.description:
A description of what is also worth knowing about you for people caring or supporting you.

  • This could include a short history of your life (where you have worked, where you lived, important events in your life, important people in your past life).
  • This could include a short profile of your current life:- your work / study, your aspirations, your skills, your networks, things you like e.g. particular foods, places, a football team and things you like to talk about, things you dislike
  • This could also include any care and support preferences that have not been included elsewhere.

concept.name: Supported to write this by
concept.description: Where relevant, this is a record of name, relationship/role and contact details of the individual who supported the person to write this section e.g. carer, family member, advocate, professional.

concept.name: Location to multimedia file
concept.description: The link to the person's multimedia file

concept.name: Individual requirements
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This is not mandatory for providing care but is deemed as a 'Must have' to support other activities.

This section allows for the sharing of any individual requirements the person may have, such as to support any cognitive impairment or mobility issues. This may relate to special needs and would extend to include a record of reasonable adjustments. Specific disabilities would be included in the ’Problem list’ section however the requirements to support the disabilities (e.g. needs wheelchair access, needs large print etc.) would be included in this section. 

The accessible information requirements information would be the most recent requirement rather than a history of requirements.
concept.description: The individual requirements of the person.

concept.name: Reasonable adjustment
concept.description: A record of reasonable adjustments that must be provided by the service to comply with the Equality Act 2010.

concept.name: Reasonable adjustment record entry
concept.description: This is a reasonable adjustment record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items

concept.name: Reasonable adjustment flag
concept.description:
Under the Equality Act 2010, organisations have a legal duty to make changes in their approach or provision to ensure that services are as accessible to people with disabilities as they are for everybody else. These changes are called reasonable adjustments.

Reasonable adjustments can mean alterations to buildings by providing lifts, wide doors, ramps and tactile signage, but may also mean changes to policies, procedures and staff training to ensure that services work equally well for people with physical or sensory disabilities, learning disabilities or long-term conditions such as dementia.

Other adjustments include longer appointments, providing easy read materials or communications via a carer. This legal duty is anticipatory which means a service should know about a person’s need for adjustments when they are referred or present for care. For this to happen, and for optimum care to be delivered, adjustments need to be recorded and shared across the NHS.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - 1108111000000107 |Requires reasonable adjustments for health and care access (Equality Act 2010) (finding)|

concept.name: Reasonable adjustment
concept.description: The reasonable adjustment required e.g. requires specific contact method, requires communication professional

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for reasonable adjustment

                                        concept)| <br clear="none"/> ^999002131000000106 |Accessible information - requires specific contact method simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)| <br clear="none"/> ^999002141000000102 |Accessible information - requires specific information format simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)| <br clear="none"/> Refsets for other categories in
                                    development

concept.implamentationGuidance: This is an impairment record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items
concept.description: This is an impairment record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items

concept.name: Impairment additional detail

Description of what the person can do with the impairment, what they want to be able to do and how they should be supported to do it and what the consequences are of not providing the support.
Where there is a sensory disability include sensory processing difficulties (e.g. affects to balance and movement, oversensitive, under-sensitive).

concept.name: Other individual requirements
concept.description: Details of any other individual requirements the person may have.

concept.name: Other individual requirement
concept.description: Other individual requirements that a person may have.

concept.name: Safeguarding
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This is not mandatory for providing care but is deemed as a 'Must have' to support other activities.

This section includes any concerns in relation to safeguarding and is applicable to unborn children and adults (children are not currently referred for Social Prescribing). It can also include information regarding an unborn Child Protection Plan.

There may be situations where it is not advisable to share information in this section with the person to whom it relates, so local implementations may need to apply filters in these cases. Appropriate policies and technical solutions need to be in place for these situations. Access must be controlled to this information as per SCCI1609: Child Protection - Information Sharing.
concept.description: The safeguarding details of the person.

concept.name: Safeguarding concerns
concept.implamentationGuidance: Details of safeguarding concerns  <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: Details of safeguarding concerns.

concept.name: Free text

concept.name: Consent
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This is not mandatory for providing care but is deemed as a 'Must have' to support other activities.

 As 'direct care' is the legal basis for sharing information consent is not mandatory however gaining a persons consent for the capturing and sharing of information for referring on or for sending information back to the referrer and registered GP ensures an individual is fully aware of who will see the information recorded and shared.  Hence it's inclusion in the standard.
concept.description: Legal information captured relating to patient care, such as consent.

concept.name: Consent for information sharing
concept.description: This is a record of consent for information sharing under the common law duty of confidentiality. Where consent has not been obtained or sought, the reason why should be provided. Include best interests decision where person lacks capacity.

concept.name: Referral details
concept.implamentationGuidance: This section includes a record of current and historic referrals. Referral details includes the service a person is being referred from. A service may not always be coded. If the service is known, and a code is available, it should be included otherwise the service should be described in free text.  <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The details of the referral.

concept.name: Referral details record entry
concept.implamentationGuidance: The record entry allows recording of multiple referrals
concept.description: This is the referral details record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Date
concept.description: The date of referral

concept.name: Referrer details
concept.implamentationGuidance: This should be completed by the system for the referrer
concept.description:
The details of the referrer that is making the referral or the transfer. <br clear="none"/> 
                             <br clear="none"/> This could be the person, GP surgery, department, specialty, sub-specialty, educational institution, mental health team, care home etc.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the referrer.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: Role of the referrer.

concept.name: Grade
concept.description: The grade of the referrer.

concept.name: Team
concept.description: The team or department of the referrer.

concept.name: Specialty
concept.implamentationGuidance: There is currently no code for Social Prescribing, so this element does not need to be used
concept.description: The specialty of the referrer.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary - Activity treatment function code

concept.name: Service
concept.description: The service of the referrer.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.implamentationGuidance: There is currently no code for Social Prescribing, so this element does not need to be used
concept.description: The coded value for service
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - 1127531000000102 |Services simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Organisation
concept.description: The organisation of the referrer.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for organisation code
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Organisation data service

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: The contact details of the referrer.

concept.name: Referral method
concept.description: The method in which a referral is sent and received. This may be a letter, email, transcript of a telephone conversation, Choose and Book, in person (self-referral) etc.
concept.valueSets:
Allow National Codes only
  1. Fax
  2. Phone
  3. Secure Messaging
  4. Secure Email
  5. Letter
  6. NHS E-Referral Service
  7. Self referral

concept.name: Reason for referral
concept.implamentationGuidance:
The presenting complaints and issues and chief complaint record’s the person reported and referrer perceived needs of the person.

 

‘Reason for referral’ is used if needed to qualify those presenting complaints or issues and the appropriateness of referring to Social Prescribing .
concept.description: The reason for the referral, e.g. diagnosis, treatment, transfer of care due to relocation, investigation, second opinion, management of the patient (e.g. palliative care), or carer's concerns.

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Referral to
concept.description:
Details of where the referral is to be sent. <br clear="none"/> 
                             <br clear="none"/> If not an individual, this could be a service, e.g. GP surgery, department, specialty, subspecialty, educational institution, mental health etc.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: Name of person the referral is to be sent to.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: Role of person where the referral is to be sent to.
concept.valueSets: FHIR values set : -  ukcorepractitionerrolecode

concept.name: Grade
concept.description: The grade of the person where the referral is sent to.

concept.name: Team
concept.description: The team or department of the person where the referral is being sent to

concept.name: Specialty
concept.description: The specialty the referral is being sent to e.g. physiotherapy, oncology, mental health etc
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary - Activity treatment function code

concept.name: Service
concept.description: The service of where the referral is sent to.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for service
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - 1127531000000102 |Services simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Organisation
concept.description: The organisation of where the referral is to be sent.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for organisation
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Organisation data service

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: The contact details of where the referral is to be sent.

concept.name: Return response to
concept.implamentationGuidance: This can be used where the outcome of a referral needs to be directed to a specific individual or team or ‘in-box’ within the referrer organisation. Systems should allow this field to be automatically completed and default to the person’s local authority. Systems should also allow for it to be potentially turned off. A decision should be made locally about how it is used.
concept.description: Name of professional to be communicated with, if not the referrer

concept.name: Contacts with professionals
concept.implamentationGuidance: This section captures details of the contacts between the social prescribing link worker and the person
concept.description: The details of the person’s contact with a professional.

concept.name: Contacts with professionals record entry
concept.description: This is a contacts record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Date and time of contact
concept.description: Date and time of the contact.

concept.name: Location of contact
concept.description: The location where the contact took place.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for location
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Organisation data service code

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Seen by
concept.implamentationGuidance: Details of the professional and their organisation should be filled in automatically from the login details
concept.description: The professional that saw the person.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the professional that saw the person

concept.name: Role
concept.description: The role of the person providing the service.
concept.valueSets: FHIR values set : -  ukcorepractitionerrolecode

concept.name: Responsible professional
concept.description: The name and role of the professional that had overall responsibility for the person e.g. consultant, nurse consultant, midwife, allied health professional (may not have actually seen the person).

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the responsible professional.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: The role of the responsible professional
concept.valueSets: FHIR values set : -  ukcorepractitionerrolecode

concept.name: Location type
concept.description: The type of location where the contact took place e.g. person's home
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary - Activity location type code

concept.name: Contact type
concept.description: Type of contact e.g. GP consultation, outpatient attendance

concept.name: Consultation method
concept.description: Consultation method used e.g. face to face, telephone
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary - Consultation mechanism

concept.name: Specialty
concept.description: The specialty e.g. physiotherapy, oncology, mental health etc
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary - Activity treatment function code

concept.name: Service
concept.description: The service that was provided.
concept.valueSets:
SNOMED CT :- 1127531000000102 |Services simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)| <br clear="none"/> 
                             <br clear="none"/>

concept.name: Professionals present
concept.description: The name, role of the additional individuals or team members including consultant(s), nurse consultant(s), allied health professional(s), social worker(s)

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the professional present

concept.name: Role
concept.description: The role of the professional present.
concept.valueSets: FHIR values set : -  ukcorepractitionerrolecode

concept.name: Outcome of contact
concept.description: This records the outcome of the contact.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- outcome of attendance

concept.name: Presenting complaints or issues
concept.implamentationGuidance: This concept is used in multiple Information Standards and in general terms describes the complaint or issues as perceived by the individual reporting the complaint or issue, including the referrer.  A person can have multiple complaints or issues recorded in an Information Standard.  <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: Presenting complaints or issues

concept.name: Presenting complaint or issue
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This is not mandatory for providing care but is deemed as a 'Must have' to support other activities.

These are the person's complaints or issues as perceived by the referrer.  There can be multiple complaints or issues.
concept.description: The health problem or issue experienced by the person resulting in their attendance. This may include disease state, medical condition, response and reactions to therapies. e.g., blackout, dizziness, chest pain, follow up from admission, falls, a specific procedure, investigation or treatment.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.implamentationGuidance: There is a new refset "Social prescribing needs and concerns simple reference set" (https://termbrowser.nhs.uk/?perspective=full&conceptId1=1373501000000105&edition=uk-edition&release=&server=https://termbrowser.nhs.uk/sct-browser-api/snomed&langRefset=999001261000000100,999000691000001104) (SCTID: 1373501000000105) which should be used in place of the "Health issues simple refset" specified in the valueset.
concept.description: The coded value for presenting complaint or issue
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - ^1127581000000103 |Health issues simple reference set|

concept.name: Free text
concept.implamentationGuidance: Use free text where a code is not available or to supplement coded information.

concept.name: Person reported complaints or issues
concept.description: Person stated description of the health problems and issues. This may differ from the clinicians impression. This may also be expressed on behalf of the person, eg by parent or carer.

concept.name: Problem list
concept.implamentationGuidance:
T his section allows for all relevant diagnoses, symptoms, conditions, problems and issues. However when referring for social prescribing, the problems here should be relevant to Social Prescribing referral.

 

This would include disabilities, including learning disabilities, and conditions such as autism where they fall into the above categories i.e. are diagnosed, seen as a problem by the person or are considered a condition or similar. Behavioural factors which are not formal diagnoses but could be seen as a problem for the person would also appear under this section or under the individual requirements section.

 

The differential diagnoses should only be included in free text in the comments field, and not in a coded diagnosis field until confirmed with confidence. In some situations a diagnosis may need to be qualified by a number of attributes to give further detail. A generic approach to these attributes (such as grade; severity; distribution; behaviour; laterality etc.) has not yet been agreed. Until this is achieved it is recommended that these features are included as free text comments.
concept.description: A summary of the problems that require investigation or treatment.

concept.name: Problem list record entry
concept.implamentationGuidance: This is optional as there may not be any problems recorded that are relevant to the referral for social prescribing <br clear="none"/>
concept.description:
This is a problem list record entry.  <br clear="none"/> 
                         <br clear="none"/> There may be 0 to many record entries under problem list.  <br clear="none"/> 
                         <br clear="none"/> Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Problem
concept.description:
A condition which needs addressing and so is important for every professional to know about when seeing the person.  <br clear="none"/> 
                             <br clear="none"/> Problems may include diagnoses, symptoms, and social or behavioural issues

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for the problem list.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - ^1127581000000103 |Health issues simple reference set|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Onset date
concept.description: A date or estimated date that the problem began

concept.name: End Date
concept.description: The date or estimated date the problem was resolved.

concept.name: Stage of disease
concept.description: The stage of the disease where relevant.

concept.name: Comment
concept.description: Supporting text may be given covering the problem.

concept.name: Clinical Summary
concept.implamentationGuidance: The Clinical / professional summary allows the Link Worker to write a brief summary that can be shared back to the referrer and/or the GP. The summary should include the outcomes and impact of the social prescribing journey including the initial assessment scores and any subsequent scores to demonstrate any improvements or lack of improvement following the completion of any interventions / prescribed services undertaken. Interventions should also be listed including those that did not work to help inform any future referrals. The summary should also include any safeguarding or risks identified .See PRSB website for examples of good summaries.
concept.description: Clinical Summary

concept.name: Clinical summary
concept.description: Summary of the encounter. Where possible, very brief. This may include interpretation of findings and results; differential diagnoses, opinion and specific action(s). Planned actions will be recorded under ‘plan’.

concept.name: Social context
concept.implamentationGuidance: This section includes information about the social setting in which the person lives, such as their household, occupational, and lifestyle factors. Social circumstances includes the person’s social background, network and personal circumstances, e.g. housing, education etc. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The social setting in which the person lives, such as their household, occupational history, and lifestyle factors.

concept.name: Household composition
concept.description: Details of the person's household composition.

concept.name: Household composition
concept.description: Description of the household composition e.g. lives alone, lives with family, lives with partner, shared accommodation etc.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value of household composition
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^1027891000000106 | Household composition findings simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Occupational history
concept.description: The current and/or previous occupation(s) of the person.

concept.name: Occupational history
concept.description: The current and/or previous occupation(s) of the person.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for occupational history
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - ^999001571000000109 | Occupation simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Educational history
concept.description: Details of the person's educational history.

concept.name: Educational history
concept.description: The current and/or previous relevant educational history of the person.

concept.name: Lifestyle choices
concept.description: The lifestyle choices made by the person which are pertinent to his or her health and well-being, e.g. physical activity level, pets, hobbies and sexual habits

concept.name: Lifestyle choices
concept.description: The lifestyle choices made by the person which are pertinent to his or her health and well-being, e.g. physical activity level, pets, hobbies and sexual preferences.

concept.name: Smoking status
concept.description: Details of the person's smoking status.

concept.name: Smoking status
concept.description: Record of any smoking use by the person.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The smoking status of the person.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT:- ^999000891000000102 |Smoking simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

concept.description: Further details recorded about the smoking status of the person

concept.description: The date the person stopped smoking (if known)

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for date stopped smoking.

concept.description: The date the person stopped smoking.

concept.description: Details of the person's alcohol intake

concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Social circumstances
concept.description: Details of the persons social circumstances

concept.name: Social circumstances
concept.description: A person’s social background, network and personal circumstances, e.g. housing. This should include whether the person is a carer .

concept.name: Access
concept.description: Details of access for the person.

concept.name: Access
concept.description: Special access requirements e.g. key safe, coded lock, which door to use, stretcher access, etc.

concept.name: Dependants
concept.description: Details of any responsibility the person has for dependants.

concept.name: Dependants
concept.description: Provide details of any responsibility the person has for dependants. In the case of children provide date of birth of the child.

concept.name: Accommodation status
concept.description: Details of the type of accommodation where the person lives.

concept.name: Accommodation status
concept.description:
An indication of the type of accommodation where the person lives.  <br clear="none"/> 
                             <br clear="none"/> This should be based on the main or permanent residence.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for accommodation status
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Accommodation status

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Household environment
concept.implamentationGuidance: This section includes information about the social setting in which the person lives, such as their household, occupational, and lifestyle factors. Social circumstances includes the person’s social background, network and personal circumstances, e.g. housing, and should also include if the person is a carer. ‘Smoking status’ should be shared using SNOMED CT rather than yes or no.
concept.description: Details of the person's household environment.

concept.name: Household environment
concept.description: Factors in the household which impact the person's health and wellbeing, to include smoking in the home, alcohol/substance use etc.

concept.name: Services and care
concept.implamentationGuidance: The system should be able to  capture share any current and previous services that the individual may be involved with.
concept.description: The services and care provided for the person.

concept.name: Services and care record entry
concept.description: This is a services and care record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Social care package name
concept.description: Name of specific type of package being provided (e.g. Reablement, Home Based Care XYZ, etc)

concept.name: Social care package type
concept.description: Higher level categorisation of package type, e.g. Adults Home Support

concept.name: Service start date
concept.description: The date service started to be provided.

concept.name: Service end date
concept.description: The date the service is planned to be ended or the actual end date.

concept.name: Local authority
concept.description: The name of the local authority providing the care package.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for local authority
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - Organisation data service

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Care funding source
concept.description: A reference to the funding source and any conditions or limitations associated.

concept.name: Signpost details
concept.implamentationGuidance: These are the details of any services that a person has been signposted too.  Signposting is in the form of providing a person with the name of an organisation and their contact details e.g. telephone number, website (it is not a referral)  <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: Details of signpost

concept.name: Signpost details record entry
concept.description: This is the signpost details record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Date
concept.description: Date of signpost.

concept.name: Signpost to
concept.description:
Details of where the signpost is to. <br clear="none"/> 
                             <br clear="none"/> If not an individual, this could be a service.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: Name of person signposted to.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: Role of person signposted to.

concept.name: Grade
concept.description: The grade of the person signposted to.

concept.name: Team
concept.description: The team or department signposted to.

concept.name: Specialty
concept.description: The specialty signposted to e.g. physiotherapy, oncology, mental health etc

concept.name: Service
concept.description: The service signposted to.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for service.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - ^1127531000000102 |Services simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available.

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: The contact details of where the person has been signposted to.

concept.name: Reason for signpost
concept.description: The reason for signposting.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for reason for signpost.

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available.

concept.name: Pregnancy status
concept.implamentationGuidance: This is to share if someone is currently pregnant and the expected due date.  This information should only be shared if someone is currently pregnant <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: Pregnancy status of the person.

concept.name: Pregnancy state
concept.description: A flag that indicates whether the person is pregnant.

concept.name: Expected delivery date
concept.description: The expected delivery date of the person.

concept.name: Assessments
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This section includes details of a person’s assessments allowing for unstructured, semistructured and structured outputs from the assessment. Some assessment outputs will be narrative and may come with their own particular sub-headings e.g. psychiatry (Presenting Problem, Personal/Family History, Mental State Examination etc.) This section would also accommodate the results of any more structured assessment tools completed (e.g. screening tools/outcomes measures such as PHQ-9 or GAD-7). Numeric results of any assessments completed can also be included.

This section includes details of a person’s assessments allowing for unstructured, semi structured and structured outputs from the assessment. Some assessment outputs will be narrative and may come with their own particular sub-headings e.g., psychiatry (Presenting Problem, Personal/Family History, Mental State Examination etc.)

This section would also accommodate the results of any more structured assessment tools completed (e.g. ONS4 Personal Wellbeing Score or Warwick-Edinburgh Mental Wellbeing Scales (WEMWBS)  Numeric results of any assessments completed can also be included.
concept.description: Details of the person's assessments

concept.name: Assessments record entry
concept.description: This is the assessments record entry. There may be 0 to many record entry/entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Assessment type
concept.description: The type of the assessment e.g. social care needs assessment.

concept.name: Assessment summary
concept.description: The summary of the assessment

concept.name: Structured assessment
concept.description: Details of the structured assessment.

concept.name: Structured assessment name
concept.description: Structured assessment name e.g. New York Heart Failure, Glasgow Coma scale, Activities of Daily Living (ADL) etc.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for structured assessment name.

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Assessment result
concept.description: The structured assessment result. This is the overall result for the assessment.

concept.name: Assessment score
concept.description: The overall structured assessment score.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for assessment score.

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Value
concept.description: The numerical value for the assessment result.
concept.valueSets: Enumerated value e.g. numeric, natural numbers. This field is mandatory if the observable entity for assessment item is used.

concept.name: Units of measure
concept.description: The units of measure for the assessment result.

concept.name: Ordinal
concept.description: The ordinal result of the assessment e.g. mild, moderate, severe.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for the ordinal result.

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Subscale result
concept.description: The subscale result for the structured assessment. This includes the result for individual questions or subsections.

concept.name: Subscale score
concept.description: The subscale score of the structured assessment. Subscales may be individual questions or subsections of the overall assessment.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for subscale item.

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Value
concept.description: The numerical value for the subscale assessment result.
concept.valueSets: Enumerated value e.g. numeric, natural numbers. This field is mandatory if the observable entity for subscale score is used.

concept.name: Units of measure
concept.description: The units of measure for the assessment subscale result.

concept.name: Ordinal
concept.description: The ordinal result of the subscale assessment e.g. mild, moderate, severe.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for the ordinal result.

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Comment
concept.description: Supporting text may be given regarding the assessment.

concept.name: Risks
concept.implamentationGuidance:
Risks are likely to fall into the categories set out in the Core Information Standard – Risk to self, risk to others, etc.

For this Standard the recording and sharing of 'Risks' was agreed to be a mandatory requirement, therefore the ability to record and share that there are 'no known risks' should be able to be recorded.

There should be mechanisms in place to validate the information in this section and for it to be reviewed regularly and if applicable ended, however the peculiarity of risk factors in mental health needs to be taken into consideration i.e. the most important factor in risk is history so information here should not be archived or filtered without careful consideration.
concept.description: Details of any risks related to the person.

concept.name: Risks record entry
concept.description: This is a risks record entry. There may be 0 to many record entry/entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Start date of risk
concept.description: The start date of the risk.

concept.name: End date of risk
concept.description: The date the risk ended.

concept.name: Risk
concept.implamentationGuidance: The risk to the person or others, this include's any risk the person might cause to them self or to others. e.g. suicide, self harm
concept.description: The risk to the person or others, this includes any risk the person might cause to themselves or to others. e.g. suicide, self harm.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for risk.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - <281694009 |Finding of at risk (finding)|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available.

concept.name: Comment
concept.description: Additional details about the risk.

concept.name: Plan and requested actions
concept.implamentationGuidance: To ensure the referrer and or GP is fully aware of the plan for the individual and any further  actions required to be carried out by the referrer or GP this section should be completed and made visible at the top of any communication.  If no actions are required this should also be clearly stated and not left blank. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The details of planned investigations, procedures and treatment, and whether this plan has been agreed with the person or their legitimate representative.

concept.name: Plan and requested actions record entry
concept.description: This is a plan and requested actions record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Actions for professionals
concept.description:
Including planned investigations, procedures and treatment for a person's identified conditions and priorities. For each action the following should be identified:outcome expectations, including the person’s expectations. A record of the planned and requested actions. May be structured (table), with actions, names, dates, status, location,
                            strategies.

concept.name: Actions for person or their carer
concept.description: For each action the following should be identified:outcome expectations, including person’s expectations. A record of the planned and requested actions. May be structured (table), with actions, names, dates, status, location, strategies.

concept.name: Agreed with the person or their legitimate representative
concept.description: Indicates whether the person or their legitimate representative has agreed the entire plan or individual aspects of treatment, expected outcomes, risks and alternative treatments. A record of the agreement of the decisions made.

concept.name: Care and support plan
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This section replicates the section in the Personalised Care and Support Plan.  Where a link worker who has read and write access to a person’s single shared care & support plan. The Link Worker can use the shared care & support plan for their social prescribing activities.  Otherwise this section should be included into the social prescribing system. 


Detailed guidance for using a Personalised Care and Support Plan is available here: https://theprsb.org/standards/personalisedcareandsupportplan/
concept.description: This records the decisions reached during conversation between the individual and health and care professional about future plans and also records progress.

concept.name: Strengths
concept.implamentationGuidance: Definition: Any strengths and assets the person has (i.e. things a person is good at or enjoys doing) relating to their goals and hopes about their health and well-being For example, ‘able to participate in leisure activities’ such as a sport in order to improve health and wellbeing by losing weight.
concept.description: Any strengths and assets the person has relating to their goals and hopes about their health and well-being.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value associated with the person's strengths.  Could be derived from the assessment of the person e.g. 300738008 |Able to participate in leisure activities (finding)|
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - 1127601000000107 | Healthcare matters simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: The person’s strengths (in free text). If the strengths are coded then this is any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the coded strength.

concept.name: Needs, concerns or problems
concept.implamentationGuidance: Needs are defined as health or care deficits identified by the person with their carer(s) or professionals and are the motivations/indications for healthcare activities. Examples of needs could be (e.g.) ‘to dress myself’; ‘to better understand what my various medications are for’; ‘to reduce pain in my knees’. • Concerns are gathered information to support continuity of care for a person. Concerns can include biological, psychological or social concerns. They may include things the person or carer is concerned about. For example, a person’s concern may be ‘the quality of social housing’; a professional’s concern could be ‘high blood pressure’ • Problems are defined as: A condition that needs addressing and is important for every professional to know about when seeing a person. Problems may include diagnoses (e.g. COPD; diabetes), symptoms (e.g. joint pain; breathlessness), disabilities (e.g. sensory impairments; amputations), health, social and behavioural issues. Problems recorded here may link to the problem list held in a shared care record or GP system for a person using services. • Goals and hopes are defined as: The overall goals, hopes, aims or targets that the person has. Including anything that the person wants to achieve that relates to their future health and wellbeing. Each goal may include a description of why it is important to the person. Goals may also be ranked in order of importance or priority to the person. For example, ‘weight loss’; smoking cessation’; ‘reducing alcohol intake’; ‘increased sleep’. ‘Goals’ tends to be historically a more medically-used term, whereas ‘hopes’ is used more widely in social care settings. • It should be possible to include tables (e.g. weekly schedule), diagrams or images (e.g. to illustrate how a person has made progress towards a goal) as well as video and audio clips (i.e. as a communication tool for individuals with complex accessibility requirements). • It should be possible to prioritise goals, indicating the importance of each goal to the person (e.g. a scale 1 to 10). • Each action may also have an associated additional indicator showing how confident the person is to carry it out (e.g. a scale from 1 to 10). • The care and support plan should be structured in a way that supports digital information exchange, with separate sections for strengths, needs and problems which can be linked to specific goals. • Of particular importance is the link between needs in a care plan and related goals. Each goal must link to specific needs, as well as any actions associated with it. Goals may also have related outcomes. • The sections associated with goals and actions that are the focus of specific care professionals should be interoperable with the care plan that professional uses for their day to day work. Updates to the care and support plan section may include: • Add, edit or archive strengths, needs, concerns or problems. If a strength/need/concern becomes more or less important, then goals may need to be changed, as will associated actions. • Add, edit or archive goals. When a goal is archived it should be possible to also archive the actions associated with it. If the actions are still valid it should be possible to attach them to another goal. • Add, edit or archive actions. Once an action has been completed (i.e. status updated to indicate it has been completed), it should be possible to archive it from the care and support plan. It should be removed from the current active view of the plan, but available to view in previous versions of the plan. • Recording outcomes related to goals. Once a goal has been achieved, it should be possible to archive it from the care and support plan, so that it is removed from the view of the current plan, but available to view in previous versions of the care and support plan.
concept.description: Details of the person needs, concerns or problems <br clear="none"/>

concept.name: Coded value
concept.implamentationGuidance: There is a new refset "Social prescribing needs and concerns simple reference set" (https://termbrowser.nhs.uk/?perspective=full&conceptId1=1373501000000105&edition=uk-edition&release=&server=https://termbrowser.nhs.uk/sct-browser-api/snomed&langRefset=999001261000000100,999000691000001104) (SCTID: 1373501000000105) which should be used in place of the "Health issues simple refset" specified in the valueset.
concept.description: The coded value associated with the person's needs, concerns or problems.

concept.name: Free text
concept.implamentationGuidance: Use free text to provide detail of the person’s need as the refset is high level categories.
concept.description: The person’s needs, concerns or problems (in free text). If the needs, concerns or problems are coded then this is any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the coded need, concern or problem. <br clear="none"/>

concept.name: Goals and hopes
concept.description: The overall goals, hopes, aims or targets that the person has. Including anything that the person wants to achieve that relates to their future health and wellbeing. Each goal may include a description of why it is important to the person. Goals may also be ranked in order of importance or priority to the person.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value associated with the person's goals, aim's and hopes. e.g. 999002111000000103 |Occupational therapy goals simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - 413350009|Finding with explicit context|: 246090004|Associated finding|=300798006 |Able to participate in sporting activities (finding)|, 408729009|Finding context|=410518001|Goal|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: The person’s goals and hopes (in free text). If the goals and hopes are coded then this is any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the coded goal or hope.

concept.name: Goal importance score
concept.description: Assessment of the person's motivations to achieve this goal, how important the goal is to the person on a scale of 1-10.

concept.name: Actions and activities
concept.description: Actions or activities the person or others plan to take to achieve the person's goals and the resources required to do this.  <p/>

concept.name: What
concept.description: What the action is and how it is to be carried out?

concept.name: Coded value
concept.implamentationGuidance: There is a new refset "Social prescribing support simple reference set" (https://termbrowser.nhs.uk/?perspective=full&conceptId1=1373511000000107&edition=uk-edition&release=&server=https://termbrowser.nhs.uk/sct-browser-api/snomed&langRefset=999001261000000100,999000691000001104) (SCTID: 1373511000000107) which should be used in place of the "Health issues simple refset" specified in the valueset.
concept.description: The coded value for the action.

concept.name: Free text
concept.implamentationGuidance: Use free text to provide detail of the activity or support to be done to help the person as the refset is high level categories.
concept.description: The person’s actions (in free text). If the actions are coded then this is any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the coded action.

concept.name: Who
concept.description: Name and role (e.g. person, carer, GP, OT, etc.) of the person, or a team, carrying out the proposed action, and, if relevant where action should take place.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the professional or person carrying out the proposed action.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: The role of the person providing the service.
concept.valueSets: FHIR values set : -  ukcorepractitionerrolecode

concept.name: Team
concept.description: The name of the team.

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: Contact details of the professional (e.g. telephone number, email address etc.).

concept.name: When
concept.description: Planned date, time, or interval, as relevant

concept.name: Suggested strategies
concept.description: Suggested strategies for potential problems.

concept.name: Status
concept.description: The status of the action or activity e.g. in progress, done, refused

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for the person's activity status
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - ^999000081000000105 | Care planning action context values simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Any supplementary or personalised information for the person's activity status

concept.name: Confidence
concept.description: How confident the person feels to carry out the action associated to the goal.

concept.name: Date last updated
concept.description: Date when action/activity record was last updated

concept.name: Review date
concept.description: When the action evaluation needs to be reviewed. SNOMED CT tag : - 425268008 | Review of care plan (procedure) |

concept.name: Stage goal
concept.description: Details of the person's stage goals

concept.name: Stage goal
concept.description: A specific sub-goal that is related to the overall goal as agreed by the person in collaboration with a professional.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded expression associated with the person's stage goal.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - 413350009|Finding with explicit context|: 246090004|Associated finding|=300798006 |Able to participate in sporting activities (finding)|, 408729009|Finding context|=410518001|Goal|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: The person’s stage goal (in free text). If the stage goal is coded then this is any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the coded stage goal.

concept.name: Outcome
concept.description: The outcome of the stage goal

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for the person's stage goal outcome.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^1127601000000107 |Healthcare matters simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Any supplementary and personalised information relating to the person's outcome.

concept.name: Goal status
concept.description: The status associated with the person's stage goal
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^999000091000000107 | Care planning goal context values simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

concept.name: Outcomes
concept.description: Outcomes of each of the person’s goals, aims and targets. Includes comments recorded by the person, date and status.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value associated with the person's overall goal outcome
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^1127601000000107 |Healthcare matters simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: The person’s outcome (in free text) of a goal. If the outcome is coded then this is any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the coded outcome.

concept.name: Goal status
concept.description: The status associated with the person's overall goal.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^999000091000000107 | Care planning goal context values simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

concept.name: Agreed with person or legitimate representative
concept.implamentationGuidance: Agreement of the plan with the person (or representative) should be recorded. If agreement cannot be obtained the reason for this should be documented. • Where a person has been unable to agree, due to, for example, lacking mental capacity, actions should be undertaken to maximise capacity and the plan should demonstrate how a person’s rights will be promoted. If a person is unable to consent, a mental capacity assessment should be attempted, and if there is no legal representative a best interest decision made.
concept.description: Indicates whether the plan was discussed and agreed with the person or legitimate representative.

concept.name: Person or legitimate representative
concept.description: Indicates whether the plan was discussed and agreed with the person or legitimate representative

concept.name: Person full name
concept.description: The full name of the person in text representation.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Person full name

concept.name: Role
concept.description: The role the professional has in relation to the person.

concept.name: Care funding source
concept.implamentationGuidance: In health and social care there may be different sources of funding (e.g. personal budget/personal health budgets) to meet the aims and goals of the person. The ‘Care Funding Source’ section should only detail the source of the funding so as to support easy resolution where a question about funding arises. The information should not include the details of the funding, which will be held in separate documents.
concept.description: A reference to the funding source and any conditions or limitations associated.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The organisation code of the care funding source
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - organisation data service

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Any further information for the person's care funding source e.g. self funded

concept.name: Date this plan was last updated
concept.implamentationGuidance: This information should be automatically retrievable from the system.
concept.description: This is a record of the date that this care and support plan was last updated.

concept.name: Other care planning documents
concept.description:
Reference other care planning documents, including the type, location and date.  <br clear="none"/> 
                         <br clear="none"/> This may include condition-specific plans, advance care plans, end of life care plan, etc.

concept.name: Planned review date/interval
concept.description: This is the date/interval when this information will next be reviewed. SNOMED CT tag : - 425268008 | Review of care plan (procedure) |

concept.name: Responsibility for review
concept.description: This is a record of who has responsibility for arranging review of this information. <br clear="none"/>

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the professional with responsibility for the care of the person.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: The role the professional has in relation to the person e.g. GP, physiotherapist, community nurse, social worker, key worker, care home manager, care coordinator, LA hospital liaison person, care home contact, hospital clinician, Independent Mental Capacity Advocate (IMCA) etc
concept.valueSets: FHIR values set : -  ukcorepractitionerrolecode

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: Contact details of the professional (e.g. telephone number, email address etc.).
